citation.article-title: Emended description of the genus Agromyces and description of Agromyces cerinus subsp. cerinus sp. nov., subsp. nov., Agromyces cerinus subsp. nitratus sp. nov., subsp. nov., Agromyces fucosus subsp. fucosus sp. nov., subsp. nov., and Agromyces fucosus subsp. hippuratus sp. nov., subsp. nov.

p.s: Description of Agromyces cerinus subsp. nitratus subsp. nov.
Agromyces cerinus subsp. nitratus (ni-tra'tus. N.L. n. nitratum, nitrate; N.L. adj. nitratus, decomposed nitrate)
Agromyces cerinus subsp. nitratus is distinguished from A. cerinus subsp. cerinus by the absence of rhamnose, tyvelose, and xylose and the presence of glucose and ribose in the cell walls.
Organic nitrogen is required for good growth.
Grows on media containing L-arabinose, maltose, melibiose, and starch as C sources.
Produces acid from maltose or mannitol; acids are not produced from D-fructose, meso-inositol, lactose, salicin, and trehalose.
The G+C content of the DNA is 72 mol% (as determined by the Tm method).
The type strain ofA. cerinus subsp. nitrutus is strain VKM Ac-1351.
The description given above was based on one strain.
